scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Record Group 2, Statements of Condition, consists of the Foundation's Annual Reports. The early reports created between 1975 and 1981 contain only general information about the Foundation. But beginning in 1982, the annual reports provide insight into the Foundation's purpose, philosophy, and grant-making activities.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Knight Foundation.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research with select materials restricted as noted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The annual reports from 1975 to 1981 are brief, listing only categories of grants and the amounts given (i.e., Journalism: $25,000). After 1982, the reports provide more detailed information about the grants given each year, including the names of grantees and the specific amount of the grant. These later reports also include a Chairman's Letter, the Foundation's statement of purpose, history, and the background and mission of each of the programs, as well as financial information about the Foundation and its assets. There is also an index of grants, a list of grants by program and type, instructions on how to apply for a grant, feature stories about grant recipients, and photographs of Trustees, Officers and staff.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence re: creation of an annual report, types of information to be included; also draft of chairman's letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Annual report of the Foundation, entitled "A Progress Report, 2007 - 2008". This is a brochure, not the full report published in previous years. The document is "a symbol of Knight Foundation's transformation into a 21st century organization. It is a slimmer, more succinct version of our traditional annual report.... You'll find this and more more content on the web .... It's a trend we expect will continue, until all of the information we provide to our constituents is digital...." Multiple copies.
